How to Install ceilometer-polling on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • ceilometer-polling

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install ceilometer-polling on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing ceilometer-polling on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall ceilometer-polling in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install ceilometer-polling, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install ceilometer-polling Using apt

To install ceilometer-polling in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install ceilometer-polling using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install ceilometer-polling

The installation of ceilometer-polling might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install ceilometer-polling Using apt-get

To install ceilometer-polling using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install ceilometer-polling.

sudo apt-get -y install ceilometer-polling

Install ceilometer-polling Using Synaptic

To install ceilometer-polling using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install ceilometer-polling on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for ceilometer-polling. This will display the ceilometer-polling package in the package window, now to install ceilometer-polling, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the ceilometer-polling package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of ceilometer-polling.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install ceilometer-polling Using aptitude

To install ceilometer-polling on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of ceilometer-polling.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install ceilometer-polling using the command aptitude install ceilometer-polling.

sudo aptitude -y install ceilometer-polling

How to Upgrade ceilometer-polling on debian

If you want to upgrade the ceilometer-polling package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade ceilometer-polling using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade ceilometer-polling to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade ceilometer-polling.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade ceilometer-polling sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade ceilometer-polling

Upgrade ceilometer-polling using Aptitude

To upgrade ceilometer-polling using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade ceilometer-polling.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade ceilometer-polling

Upgrade ceilometer-polling using Synaptic

To upgrade ceilometer-polling using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for ceilometer-polling, now right-click ceilometer-polling, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade ceilometer-polling just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall ceilometer-polling on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall ceilometer-polling from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just ceilometer-polling, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove ceilometer-polling

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of ceilometer-polling

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of ceilometer-polling you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge ceilometer-polling

Remove ceilometer-polling using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall ceilometer-polling using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for ceilometer-polling, right-click the ceilometer-polling package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall ceilometer-polling click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install ceilometer-polling on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade ceilometer-polling using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
